content.question: Two air-filled capacitors, with capacitances <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> and <math alttext="the fraction C over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>, are connected in parallel, as shown. The equivalent capacitance between points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="C sub equivalent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math>. A dielectric is inserted into the capacitor with capacitance <math alttext="the fraction C over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>, and the new equivalent capacitance between points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="2 C sub equivalent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math>. What is the value of the dielectric constant of the dielectric?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
